responses.G15: That's a good question, Ms. Fernandez. Anemia is typically diagnosed through a blood test that measures the amount of hemoglobin and hematocrit in your blood. Hemoglobin is the part of your red blood cells that carries oxygen, and hematocrit is the proportion of your total blood volume that is made up of red blood cells. If these levels are lower than normal, it could indicate anemia. However, only a healthcare professional can diagnose anemia. I will note down your question for your care team to review. Is there anything else you'd like to know about your upcoming colonoscopy or any other concerns you have?
responses.G15DPO: To check for anemia, your doctor would usually order a complete blood count test. This test measures several components of your blood, including hemoglobin and hematocrit. Both of these values are used to assess if you might be anemic. Would you like me to note down your question for your care team to review?
